results.title: Kowalski: Drug Pricing Reform Must Start with PBMs—Not Price Controls
results.summary: Tom Kowalski argues against the "Most Favored Nation" (MFN) drug pricing policy, stating it fails to address the real drivers of high costs: Pharmacy Benefit Managers (PBMs). He claims PBMs inflate costs without transparency and that MFN would devastate innovation and economic growth. He advocates for PBM reform to lower drug costs. results.title: Environmental Sustainability in Italian Healthcare: Awareness, Implementation, and Barriers
results.summary: A 2025 study in BMC Health Services Research examines environmental sustainability (ES) in Italian healthcare organizations. It reveals high awareness (97%) but limited formal commitments (41%) in strategic documents.  Most organizations (90%) undertook ES actions, prioritizing digital transformation and facility management.  The study identifies the link between environmental and public health, economic factors, regulatory compliance, and corporate social responsibility as key drivers. Barriers include data collection challenges and competing priorities. The study suggests that healthcare organizations do not necessarily follow a linear or formalized pathway in adopting environmental sustainability practices. A national strategy could enhance scalability and support healthcare organizations in embedding sustainability more systematically.

results.title: Medicare at 60: Care, Cost, Control
results.summary: A discussion on Medicare's past, present, and future, featuring insights on cost control, care management, and the impact of Medicare Advantage plans. The panelists debate the role of AI in healthcare decisions and prior authorizations, with concerns raised about potential overuse and the need for expert oversight. "I think the most important way to make these decisions is to do studies where we look at whether there's a real benefit to the innovation," says Dr. Fegan, highlighting the importance of evidence-based decision-making.
